daa0aa08c599.bio: Trying to find my way again.

paragraphs.text: I know you are tired. I know you are drowning in shame. But listen, we are getting out of this hole. We have made so much progress. I am not giving up on you. I am not leaving.

You dreamed of a world where you can be a child and not a parent. Because you were not ready to be a parent. Where you can play, get curious, be silly, trip, fall, stand up, get lost, and come back home.
paragraphs.name: 50fb

paragraphs.text: You dreamed of a world where you can be a child and not a parent. Because you were not ready to be a parent. Where you can play, get curious, be silly, trip, fall, stand up, get lost, and come back home.
paragraphs.name: 50fb

paragraphs.text: Your 32 year old self

I am committed to restoring safety in your life. I owe this life to you. If it weren’t for your grit, courage, intelligence, strength, and resilience I would not be sitting here today, at a cafe in San Francisco drinking an almond hot chocolate, wearing comfy yoga clothes, on a sunny afternoon, writing a letter to you on an apple laptop, getting ready to go to a Hakomi session.
paragraphs.name: f40e

paragraphs.text: You dreamed of a world where you can be a child and not a parent. Because you were not ready to be a parent. Where you can play, get curious, be silly, trip, fall, stand up, get lost, and come back home.
paragraphs.name: 50fb

paragraphs.text: I know you are scared. I can see it in the trembling of your spine. You are scared of turning to face the reality of a man you once loved with a gun. You are too scared to run because they told you these walls are here to stay. You want to shrink so they don’t see you anymore. Can they forget you exist?
paragraphs.name: 0bc0
6b60
paragraphs.text: Never.

paragraphs.name: 9df4
paragraphs.text: There is none of that. Even as an adult, still can’t seem to let my hair down without the guilt and shame.

paragraphs.name: f327
paragraphs.text: Thank you for this. My C-PTSD has been extremely bad for the past several months and I am struggling. The past week has been especially hard, and this felt very meaningful to read today. Thank you. 💚

paragraphs.name: 959c
paragraphs.text: God yes. Every day. I am so tired of being the damn adult. The parent for poor life choices. Damn it.

paragraphs.text: Dear Jessica,

paragraphs.name: dc92
paragraphs.text: For once, let me borrow from the loving and tender atmosphere of “Summertime” by DuBose Heyward and the Gershwin Bros. To your 4 year and 32 year old self: “ One of these mornings, you’re going to rise up singing, then you’ll spread your wings, and you’ll take to the sky…”

paragraphs.name: 3cc8
paragraphs.text: All the best and more,

paragraphs.name: dd22
paragraphs.text: P

paragraphs.name: cdd8
paragraphs.text: Every single day.

6f6cca925d64.title: A very moving and powerful piece to which I can relate wholeheartedly and a theme about which I…

paragraphs.name: 7aba
paragraphs.text: A very moving and powerful piece to which I can relate wholeheartedly and a theme about which I write my narratives and memoirs too. I am so glad you found refuge as I did eventually too, although in different ways, and how those experiences continue to grow through each day and each moment, healing healing healing those wounded memories until they…

9b65a01c4268.title: …thank you for this…in all the healing work I’ve done over the last 30 years, I never thought of…

paragraphs.text: …thank you for this…in all the healing work I’ve done over the last 30 years, I never thought of writing such a letter…you letter, of course, addresses your experiences (and so beautifully) but I cried as though they were my own while a subtle translation of all the ways of wounding children took place inside my soul… you write for a whole heartbroken world…

7c99f6792015.title: This is beautiful and it brought me to tears. I always get happy when I see your work in my feed ❤

paragraphs.name: 8d21
paragraphs.text: This is beautiful and it brought me to tears. I always get happy when I see your work in my feed ❤

paragraphs.name: 29b7
paragraphs.text: Thank you! I have begun my journey of recovery and your words are beautiful and encouraging as this is my goal. Re parenting myself and letting childhood wounds heal as I become the woman I am meant to be.

paragraphs.text: And to those of us who had difficult childhood

paragraphs.name: 4a9a
paragraphs.text: So heartfelt words ❤. Thank you for having the courage to transform your life challenges in this beautiful, soulful energy and for helping others see their pearl in the darkness. And yes “You have given love and hope to strangers. The love in you can fill up the sky.”
